newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices dip on weak consumer demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices dip on weak consumer demand.

text.p: Indian sugar prices dipped on Tuesday on sluggish consumer demand despite the coming festival season, dealers said.
In ready delivery sugar S-30 fell by 5.0 rupees to 1,360/1,390 rupees per quintal while M-30 slid by 10 rupees to 1,390/1,430 rupees.
"Seasonal demand in the open market remained at low ebb due to improved supplies of sugar pumped in by the government in the public distribution system," a broker said.
Overall market sentiments was subdued at the close of the session. -- Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
